question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump Jr. going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be resolved as **No**. This question is not limited to those candidates currently under consideration; additional candidates may emerge later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; it is solely based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both Donald Trump Jr. and Asa Hutchinson be selected as the Republican nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

not_P.title: Will either Donald Trump Jr. or Asa Hutchinson not be selected as the Republican nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

All other outcomes will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is it possible that Donald Trump Jr. or Asa Hutchinson will be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either Donald Trump Jr. or Asa Hutchinson is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other contenders will be answered with **No**. This question is open to the inclusion of other candidates not currently mentioned; additional options may emerge in the future.

For the purposes of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republicans on the actual day of the 2024 US election; the determination is exclusively based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

not_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic...nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for President?

This resolves the same way as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be marked as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

To be classified as a Yes, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any doubt that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not issued before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be marked as No.

Additional details and background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question resolves, its outcome will be automatically applied to this market. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Feel free to contact @jskf for early resolution requests or to report any issues.

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

not_P.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is <=46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Are Kamala's chances of victory expected to rise in the coming week based on Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the Electoral College likelihood for Harris in Nate Silver's analysis exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. If it does not, it will be a NO.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, AND will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this resolves as No.

(2) Will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? This resolves as Yes if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. Resolves No otherwise.

This question will resolve as Yes if both (1) and (2) resolve as Yes.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic nomination for President, OR will Kamala Harris's odds of winning not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
not_P.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement that he will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this resolves as No.

(2) Will Kamala Harris's odds of winning not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? This resolves as Yes if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is ≤46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. Resolves No otherwise.

This question will resolve as Yes if either (1) or (2) resolve as Yes.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a declaration before July 15, 2024, stating he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, AND will the likelihood of Kamala Harris winning rise in the coming week according to Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden make a public statement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be considered Yes if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and official announcement that he will not seek or accept the nomination for a new term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear-cut and definitive, eliminating any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the nomination in the 2024 election. If such an announcement does not occur before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this will be considered No.

(2) Will the probability of Kamala Harris winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's analysis? This will be considered Yes if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. It will be No otherwise.

This question will be answered as Yes if both (1) and (2) are answered as Yes.

question.title: Will either Joe Biden announce he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President before July 15, 2024, or Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body: (a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination for a Yes resolution. (b) Will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Will neither Joe Biden announce he will accept the Democratic nomination for President before July 15, 2024, nor will Kamala Harris's odds of winning decrease over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
not_P.body: (a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must leave no room for the possibility that Biden would decline the nomination for a Yes resolution. (b) Will Kamala Harris's odds of winning decrease over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is ≤46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will declare he won't pursue the Democratic nomination for President prior to July 15, 2024, or that Kamala Harris's chances of winning will rise in the upcoming week based on Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body: (a) Is it true that Joe Biden will publicly state before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This is considered a Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official declaration that he will not seek or accept the nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the nomination for a Yes outcome. (b) Will the likelihood of Kamala Harris winning improve in the next week according to Nate Silver's predictions? This is a Yes if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. It is a No in other cases.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is Joe Biden expected to pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's passing prior to market closure at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will Biden not remain President through end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President through the end of July 2024. 

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Is it possible for Biden to stay in office as President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This question resolves to YES if Biden continues to hold the position of US President until the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution, as an Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday and remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, and (b) Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). It resolves NO if either condition is not met. Note that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect the resolution of condition (b).

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday or not remain President through end of July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves YES if either of the following conditions is not met: (a) There is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, or (b) Joe Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). It resolves NO if both conditions are met. Note that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect the resolution of condition (b).

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden pass away prior to Saturday and continue as President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry is answered with YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (a) An official declaration of Joe Biden's passing occurs before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, and (b) Joe Biden stays as the US President until the end of July 2024 (ET). It is answered with NO if either of the criteria is not satisfied. Please note that a temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment does not influence the resolution of condition (b).

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden dies before Saturday, July 26th, 2024, or (b) Biden does not remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

(b) Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This includes if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden dies before Saturday, July 26th, 2024, nor (b) Biden remains President through the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

(b) Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This includes if he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either (a) Joe Biden passes away prior to Saturday, July 26th, 2024, or (b) he is no longer in the role of President by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's passing before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, 2024. If not, it will be marked as NO.

(b) This will be marked as YES if Biden is not serving as the US President by the end of July 2024 (ET). This includes scenarios where he resigns, dies, or otherwise stops being President before that date. A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) will not result in a YES resolution, as the Acting President is considered distinct from the President according to the Constitution.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The absence of removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion is verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The inquiry will conclude with a "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may take place after the specified date. It solely concerns whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded from a ballot and subsequently reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question may take into account new candidates that may emerge later.

For the purposes of this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; it is only based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports, and not through speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements. The question resolves as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: This does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after the date. If Trump is removed or blocked and then reinstated such that on July 15th he is not removed or blocked, the question resolves negatively.

(b) This question will resolve as "Yes" if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as "No". The question solely determines by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, nor (b) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports, and not through speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements. The question resolves as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024. Note: This does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after the date. If Trump is removed or blocked and then reinstated such that on July 15th he is not removed or blocked, the question resolves positively.

(b) This question will resolve as "Yes" if Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as "Yes". The question solely determines by who is not selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will happen: (a) Donald Trump is prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be answered "Yes" if, by July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable news sources, and not through conjectural articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements. The question will be answered "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024. Note: This does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals after this date. If Trump is blocked and later reinstated such that on July 15th he is not blocked, the question will resolve negatively.

(b) This question will be answered "Yes" if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election. All other candidates will be answered "No". The resolution of this question is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, or (b) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if either of the following conditions is met:

(a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, and not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, nor (b) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if neither of the following conditions is met:

(a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

(b) Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution is solely determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, and not who does not receive the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either (a) Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, or (b) Donald Trump will become the Republican candidate for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed "Yes" if either of the following scenarios occurs:

(a) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This disqualification or barring must be substantiated by official state government announcements, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative accounts, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that might take place after the specified date. It strictly addresses whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds by July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot but then reinstated, leading to his status being not disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the question will resolve negatively.

(b) Donald Trump is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election. The resolution is exclusively based on who is appointed by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not on who is nominated on the day of the 2024 U.S. election.
